description: A replicationController resource. A replicationController helps to create and manage a set of pods. It acts as a factory to create new pods based on a template. It ensures that there are a specific number of pods running. If fewer pods are running than `replicas` then the needed pods are generated using `podTemplate`. If more pods are running than `replicas`, then excess pods are deleted.

desiredState.description: The desired configuration of the replicationController

replicas.description: Number of pods desired in the set

replicaSelector.description: Required labels used to identify pods in the set

podTemplate.description: Template from which to create new pods, as necessary. Identical to pod schema.

desiredState.description: The desired configuration of the pod

manifest.description: Manifest describing group of [Docker containers](http://docker.io); compatible with format used by [Google Cloud Platform's container-vm images](https://developers.google.com/compute/docs/containers)

currentState.description: The current state of the replicationController

replicas.description: Number of pods currently in the set

podTemplate.description: Template from which to create new pods, as necessary. Identical to pod schema.
